steps.title: Cut off the lettuce root on leaf lettuce.
steps.content: Cut off the lettuce root on leaf lettuce. Use a knife or your hands to break the root off of the lettuce and cut off any wilted spots. Separate the leaves of the lettuce with your hands. [1] X Research source Be careful when using a knife so you don’t hurt yourself. Make sure your fingers are away from the blade when you cut.

steps.title: Remove the core from iceberg lettuce.
steps.content: Remove the core from iceberg lettuce. If you are using iceberg lettuce, use a paring knife to remove the core then break apart the leaves with your hands. Keep in mind that some iceberg lettuce heads are very firm. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Fill a large bowl with cool water.
steps.content: Fill a large bowl with cool water. Soak your lettuce in a large amount of cold water. Move the water around by swirling the water vigorously. If you got the lettuce from a farmer's market, it will probably be more dirty than from the store. [3] X Research source If you are going to dry the lettuce with a spinner, wash the leaves in the bowl and colander that came with your spinner. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Inspect whole heads.
steps.content: Inspect whole heads. If you are washing whole heads of lettuce, make sure to thoroughly inspect them. Gently open the heads and check between the leaves for dirt. Gently bend the leaves back and away from the core to allow water to get between the leaves. Make sure to check the area where the leaves are attached to the stem. [5] X Research source You can leave the lettuce heads together for grilling. [6] X Research source If the lettuce was in your fridge for a while and there’s colored liquid in the bottom of the bag it came in, your lettuce has gone bad, unfortunately.

steps.title: Let the dirt fall to the bottom of the bowl.
steps.content: Let the dirt fall to the bottom of the bowl. Walk away from the leaves and let the dirt settle to the bottom of the bowl. After about 10 minutes, take the greens out of the water. Make sure not to go near the dirt at the bottom of the bowl. Gently shake the excess water off of the leaves and lay them on a paper towel. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Spin the lettuce.
steps.content: Spin the lettuce. The easiest way to dry lettuce is with a spinner. Once the leaves are washed, take the colander, with the lettuce inside, out of the bowl. Pour out any water from the bowl and put the colander back inside the bowl. Put the lid on top of the bowl and turn the handle to spin the lettuce to dry out the leaves. [8] X Research source Only dry separated leaves in a spinner, not whole heads. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Roll the lettuce in a towel.
steps.content: Roll the lettuce in a towel. You can dry lettuce by rolling it in a towel. Shake extra water off of the leaves and lay them in a single layer on a towel. Start rolling the towel (starting at the end near you). Lightly press against the green while you roll. If you push too hard, you might bruise the leaves. Unroll the towel and the lettuce should be dry. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Shake the lettuce.
steps.content: Shake the lettuce. Drain the lettuce in a colander. Cover the top of the colander with a towel (wrap it around the edges to keep it in place). Shake the colander over the sink, in every direction. When the leaves are dry, take them out. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Swing the lettuce in a towel.
steps.content: Swing the lettuce in a towel. Put the wet lettuce leaves in the center of a towel or a clean pillowcase. Bring all four corners together and twist the towel or pillowcase. Gather the ends in one hand and swing the towel around several times. You probably want to do this outside or in the bathroom because water might splatter. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Store the lettuce.
steps.content: Store the lettuce. Lay any extra leaves on a paper towel. Roll up the paper towel with the leaves inside. Put the rolled up paper towel in a plastic bag and refrigerate it. It should last for about five to six days. [13] X Research source
